intro: Ptilotus cunninghamii, commonly known as the "Desert Flax," is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its striking yellow or orange flowers that bloom during the warmer months. The plant has slender, branching stems and produces small, linear leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland desert regions. Ptilotus cunninghamii is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
